overview_of_class: The course will explore the diverse histories, identities, and experiences of Chicago's heterogeneous Latinx populations through an interdisciplinary and multi-disciplinary framework. We will examine the formation and transformation of various Mexican, Puerto Rican, and other Latinx communities in Chicago. We will investigate how Latinxs define and understand their respective histories, communities, resilience, and struggles. We will also interrogate the creation and engagement with Latinidades, an identification as a pan-Latinx group. To that end, we will explore inter- and intra-Latinx cultural expressions, relationships, and collaborations. Lastly, we will discuss how the scholarship on Latinxs in Chicago has shaped the field of Latinx Studies.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
By the end of the course students will be able to:
1. Articulate how, and under what circumstances, Latinxs have migrated to Chicago;
2. Synthesize the diverse histories of Latinx political activism and its current manifestations;
3. Describe and analyze the concept of Latinidades;
4. Identify and enage inter- and intra-Latinx social and cultural relationships and expressions; and
5. Summarize how the scholarship on Latinxs in Chicago has shaped the field of Latinx Studies.
